prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with Tapered Top and Bottom** **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Step 2: Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane** Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. This sketch will have six lines as follows: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.25] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.25], End Point [0.5, 0.25] * Line 4: Start Point [0.5, 0.25], End Point [0.25, 0.625] * Line 5: Start Point [0.25, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.625] * Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.0] These lines form a closed loop, which makes up the face of the 3D sketch. The face is scaled by a factor of 0.75. **Step 3: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D** Transform the 2D sketch into 3D by extruding it in the direction opposite to the normal. The extrusion depth towards normal is 0.0 and the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.5. **Step 4: Complete the part** The part is now complete and has the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.5 * Height: 0.75 The part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. It has been created using the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" boolean operation. Note: Specific boolean operation terms such as 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' have not been used in the instructions to describe the boolean operation of the current part with the previous body. Instead, their natural language descriptions have been used.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.25]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.25],"End Point":[0.5,0.25]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.25],"End Point":[0.25,0.625]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.625]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.5,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A Long, Rectangular, Metallic Object with a Smooth Surface Step 1: Create the coordinate system Start by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw two concentric rectangles and two concentric circles, ensuring the rectangles are tangent to the circles on all four corners. Rectangle 1: - Top left corner: (0.0, 0.0068) - Bottom right corner: (0.0477, 0.0) Circle 1 (inner circle): - Center point: (0.0265, 0.0265) - Radius: 0.0265 Rectangle 2 (outer rectangle): - Top left corner: (0.0, 0.0545) - Bottom right corner: (0.0545, 0.0068) Circle 2 (outer circle): - Center point: (0.0265, 0.078) - Radius: 0.0511 Step 3: Create loops for each face Create two loops: one for the inner rectangle and circle, and one for the outer rectangle and circle. Each loop should be closed and should not consist of lines and circles or arcs and circles combined. Loop 1: - Arc 1: Connect the top-left corner of the inner rectangle to the midpoint on the left side. - Line 1: Connect the midpoint to the bottom-left corner of the inner rectangle. - Arc 2: Connect the bottom-left corner to the midpoint on the bottom side. - Line 2: Connect the midpoint to the bottom-right corner of the inner rectangle. - Arc 3: Connect the bottom-right corner to the midpoint on the right side. - Line 3: Connect the midpoint to the top-right corner of the inner rectangle. - Arc 4: Connect the top-right corner to the midpoint on the top side. - Line 4: Connect the midpoint to the top-left corner of the inner rectangle. Loop 2: - Arc 1: Connect the top-left corner of the outer rectangle to the midpoint on the left side. - Line 1: Connect the midpoint to the bottom-left corner of the outer rectangle. - Arc 2: Connect the bottom-left corner to the midpoint on the bottom side. - Line 2: Connect the midpoint to the bottom-right corner of the outer rectangle. - Arc 3: Connect the bottom-right corner to the midpoint on the right side. - Line 3: Connect the midpoint to the top-right corner of the outer rectangle. - Arc 4: Connect the top-right corner to the midpoint on the top side. - Line 4: Connect the midpoint to the top-left corner of the outer rectangle. Step 4: Extrude the 2D Sketch Extrude the sketch, creating a new solid body with a depth of 0.1875 in both the positive and negative Z directions, maintaining the smooth surface and using the given sketch scale of 0.0545.</description>

<description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the Euler angles to -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 and the translation vector to 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Create a new 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create loop 1 in the sketch with the following lines: * line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.5, 0.0) * line 2: Start Point (0.5, 0.0), End Point (0.5, 0.625) * line 3: Start Point (0.5, 0.625), End Point (0.25, 0.625) * line 4: Start Point (0.25, 0.625), End Point (0.25, 0.25) * line 5: Start Point (0.25, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.25) * line 6: Start Point (0.0, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.0) The sketch should be a rectangle with a height of 0.625, a width of 0.5, and a length of 0.25. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.625. Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.75 in the direction of the normal and 0 in the opposite direction of the normal. **Part 2: Construct a smaller three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Create a new coordinate system for part 2. Set the Euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and the translation vector to 0.25, 0.25, 0.625. Create a new 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create loop 1 in the sketch with the following lines: * line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.25, 0.0) * line 2: Start Point (0.25, 0.0), End Point (0.25, 0.25) * line 3: Start Point (0.25, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.25) * line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.25), End Point (0.0, 0.0) The sketch should be a rectangle with a height of 0.25, a width of 0.25, and a length of 0.125. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.25. Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.125 in the opposite direction of the normal and 0 in the direction of the normal. **Final Shape: Construct a three-dimensional geometric shape with a rectangular base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line.** Combine the two parts together using a join operation to form the final shape. The final shape should have a rectangular base with dimensions 0.25 x 0.25, a triangular top with dimensions 0.25 x 0.125, and a height of 0.75 + 0.125 = 0.875.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1 - Construct a rectangular prism with a curved side** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at position (0, 0, 0.0833) with euler angles (0, 0, 0). Sketch the following shape on the x-y plane: - Draw a rectangle with vertices at (0, 0), (0.75, 0), (0.75, 0.3333), and (0, 0.3333) - Draw a smaller rectangle inside the previous one with vertices at (0.0, 0.0417), (0.5833, 0.0417), (0.5833, 0.2917), and (0.0, 0.2917) - Draw a line connecting the bottom-left corner of the smaller rectangle to the corresponding corner of the larger rectangle - Draw a line connecting the top-right corner of the smaller rectangle to the corresponding corner of the larger rectangle The resulting shape should have a curved side connecting the two rectangles. Extrude the sketch by 0.0417 units in the positive z-direction. **Part 2 - Construct a rectangular prism** Create a new coordinate system at position (0, 0.0417, 0.0833) with euler angles (0, 0, 0). Sketch a rectangle on the x-y plane with vertices at (0, 0), (0.5833, 0), (0.5833, 0.25), and (0, 0.25). Extrude the sketch by 0.0833 units in the negative z-direction. **Part 3 - Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end** Create a new coordinate system at position (0.6953, 0, 0.112) with euler angles (0, 0, -90). Sketch a circle on the x-y plane with center at (0.013, 0.013) and radius 0.013. Sketch a rectangle on the y-z plane with vertices at (0, 0), (0.25, 0), (0.25, 0.0521), and (0, 0.0521). Extrude the sketch by 0.0833 units in the negative x-direction.</description>
